text: Cora Amalia Castilla Madrid (27 January 1961 in Chetumal, Quintana Roo) is a Mexican politician and activist. A member of the Partido Revolucionario Institucional (PRI), she was municipal president of the municipality of Othón P. Blanco from 2005–2008, President of the PRI in Quintana Roo (2009-2011), and has been Secretary of Culture of the State Government of Quintana Roo and Deputy to the Local Congress twice. ==References== Category:Institutional Revolutionary Party politicians Category:Mexican women's rights activists Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Quintana Roo Category:People from Chetumal, Quintana Roo
title: Cora Amalia Castilla
